FuncDef:
The te bandwidth command sets or modifies the bandwidth of a BC.
By default, no BC bandwidth is configured for a link.
CLIs: te bandwidth { bc0 <bc0Bw> | bc1 <bc1Bw> | bc2 <bc2Bw> | bc3 <bc3Bw> | bc4 <bc4Bw> | bc5 <bc5Bw> | bc6 <bc6Bw> | bc7 <bc7Bw> } *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the bandwidth of BC0.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of BC1.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of BC2.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of BC3.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of BC4.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of BC5.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of BC6.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the bandwidth of BC7.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In real-world situations, the command needs to be run only on the outbound interface of a link through which a TE tunnel passes.
If the command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
MPLS TE-related commands apply only to MPLS TE and SR-MPLS TE. However, this command applies to SRv6 TE Policies, besides MPLS TE and SR-MPLS TE.
